Package data

Class Field

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.Field
  • public class Field
extends java.lang.Object
    A field can be planted with vines. Each player owns 3 fields. A field can be harvest once per year, yielding some quantity of WineTokens depending on the vines planted in it. The total value of vines cannot exceed the max value of a field.

    Note: the board game rules differentiates between grape tokens and wine tokens, but the "data structure" is functionally identical. See WineToken for more detail

    A field can also be sold for it's maxValue, or bought back for it's maxValue

    Structures that affect fields: Some vines require a Trellis and/or Irrigation in order to plant them in a field. Windmill: gain 1 VP when planting a vine (max 1 per year). Yoke: Can Place a worker here as an action to Uproot or Harvest one field once per year.

    Author:
    leahj

      Field​(int maxValue)
      Fields have a maxValue of 5, 6, or 7.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Field

        public Field​(int maxValue)
        Fields have a maxValue of 5, 6, or 7. This determines the maximum total value of vines that can be planted there, as well as the amount of gold they are worth. This is determined in player constructor.
        Parameters:
        maxValue -

    • Method Detail

      • plantVine

        public void plantVine​(Vine vine)
        Given a Vine card, we check whether there is room for this vine in this field. Then we add the vine card to plantedVines ArrayList, and then update currentValue with value of this vine.
        Parameters:
        vine -

      • harvestField

        public WineToken[] harvestField()
        Field side of harvesting. This method is called by the player when they want to harvest. First, we determine the appropriate length of WineToken[] harvest by counting the number of WineTokens that will be yielded from all cards in this field. Pinot is the only grape that creates 2 tokens(1 red and 1 white). Then, we populate the WineToken[] harvest with new appropriate WineTokens depending on the "Colors" (NOT variety) of a given vine. Remember, Colors can be "Red" or "White" for grape tokens, Variety e.g. is "Syrah".
        Returns:
        WineToken[]
